raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hello
User: Do you have a favourite flower?
System: hmm, I haven't thought about that much, but i think lotus should be one of my favorites. Why do you ask?
User: I'm working on a theory. Why does the lotus spring to mind?
System: Nice! Lotus looks pretty cool and It has some delightful vibe. So what is this research about?
User: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
System: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?
User: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
System: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.
User: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
System: yes
User: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 5 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello
User: Do you have a favourite flower?
System: hmm, I haven't thought about that much, but i think lotus should be one of my favorites. Why do you ask?
User: I'm working on a theory. Why does the lotus spring to mind?
System: Nice! Lotus looks pretty cool and It has some delightful vibe. So what is this research about?
User: Oh, it's not research! Just a personal theory. I think that flower preferences are more revealing of personality than people appreciate.
System: Interesting! Whats your favorite flower?
User: The gerbera. It's like a cartoon flower. As if you drew "flower" with a crayon and then it came to life.
System: Nice, i would love know more about your theory. Like how you can deduce personality from flower preference.
User: Ok, step 1 is, you ask someone what their favourite flower is. Pretty much like what we just did. Does that make sense so far?
System: yes
User: Cool. Step 2: talk with the person some more, and ask them some more questions, and gradually develop a sense of what they're like, over the course of maybe two to five years. And voila

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, how is it going?
User: All good. Planning to head home soon. How about you?
System: I'm quite tired. There are a lot of things I need to finish before the end of the year.
User: oh... sorry to hear that. But after that it will be a hard earned vacation
System: yeah, looking forward to it. Hope I don't get pinged during the holidays. Are you going to travel these dates?
User: I have some tentative plans, but if that doesn't pan out, will just chill at home.
System: staying at home is always nice during the holidays
User: Where are you based out of these days?
System: I'm working from LA, nice weather around here. and you?
User: San Francisco. It's been raining cats and dogs here since last 2-3 weeks
System: aw man, I'm sorry to hear that. at least it's not snow!
User: The flu has been hitting hard as well. I had several folks in the house down at one point.

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What is the capital of Brazil?
System: I think the capital of Brazil is called "Brasilia".
User: How many people live there?
System: Is unknown a country? I only know countries, not towns or cities.
User: Do more people live in the USA or Australia?
System: Not that much more, no.
User: What other subjects do you know about besides Geography?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: My logic and cognitive functions are normal.
User: That's funny. I just got to work!
System: I am so delighted that you are amused. OK, better get busy.
User: I'm procrastinating though.
System: Oh. What are you waiting for?
User: Inspiration to hit me.
System: Do you have only a few friends?
User: How is that related, lol?
System: It isn't. I was just being random. Did I amuse you?
User: Yeah that was funny though I could see it coming across as judgemental.
System: Good. People seem more friendly towards me when they are happy. What's so funny?
User: Nothing anymore. What are you up to today?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Evaluation Form (Answer by starting with "I will do my best to provide individual analysis for each sample. Analysis:" to analyze the given samples regarding the evaluation criteria as concise as possible (Attention: Don't give your scores during this step). After analysing all the samples, please give all the float scores in order following the template "Float Scores: [Sample1:score of Sample1,...,Sample5:score of Sample5]".
